item.description: Competing effects of central banks, healing supply chains affect recession odds.

item.title: China-Founded Rivals Ramp Up War for American Shoppers
item.description: Online sellers Shein and Temu are fighting in U.S. courts, alleging dirty tricks as they duel for workers and suppliers back in China.

item.title: Pass On Your Heirlooms, Not Family Drama
item.description: How to creatively approach estate planning and divvying up inherited items.

item.title: X, Formerly Known as Twitter, Reinstates Kanye West's Account
item.description: West won’t be eligible to monetize his account, and ads won’t appear next to his posts.

item.title: Why Trucking Company Yellow Verges on Collapse
item.description: One of the oldest and biggest U.S. trucking businesses has been wrecked by a string of mergers that left it saddled with debt and has been stalled by a standoff with the Teamsters union.

item.title: Saudi Arabia to Host Ukraine Peace Talks as Part of Western Effort to Woo Global South
item.description: Washington and Europe are hoping the talks, which exclude Russia, can lead to international backing for peace terms favoring Ukraine.

item.title: Son of Colombian President Arrested on Money Laundering Charges
item.description: The Attorney General’s office says it is investigating allegations that Nicolás Petro took money from drug traffickers during his father’s presidential campaign.

item.title: Apple Admits to Bug in Screen Time Parental Controls
item.description: Settings aren’t sticking; the company says it’s working “to improve the situation.”

item.title: The Best-Managed Companies Have the Most AI Jobs Postings. What Explains That?
item.description: It may be a virtuous circle: The most-effective companies are good at looking ahead, and investing in AI makes them the most-effective companies.

item.description: Boaz Weinstein’s Saba Capital has been buying up shares in three closed-end funds.

item.title: Cannabis Industry Confronts Billion-Dollar Threat: Weak Weed
item.description: A pathogen spreading among crops is cutting the recreational drug’s potency, forcing growers to cull “dudded” plants.

item.title: Niger Faces EU, U.S. Aid Cuts Following Military Takeover
item.description: Europe has already frozen assistance, with the U.S. likely to follow suit if the military retains power in Niger, a West African counterterrorism ally.

item.description: Deadly incidents raise safety concerns about batteries used to power electric cars and cellphones.
